So, I've been thinking about Dudley and his gender. It's interesting to note that being a man is a social construct, but it's also a fundamental aspect of who he is as an individual. I'd say the certainty around this topic is high, because we all have a pretty good understanding of what it means to be male or female. But at the same time, there's still so much nuance and complexity to explore when it comes to gender identity. Overall, I'd rate the polarity as neutral, because while there are certainly debates and discussions around this topic, there's also a lot of common ground and understanding. Sentiment-wise, I'd say it's mostly positive, because we're learning more about each other and working to create a more inclusive society. Emotionally, I think it's a bit of a mix - on the one hand, there can be frustration and anger when people are misunderstood or marginalized; but on the other hand, there's also a sense of hope and excitement for the progress we're making.
